How night came to 
 Opio’s vilage 
 
 Robert Ekuka 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Long ago, there was no night in Opio’s
 
 vilage. 
 People slept when they were tired and
 worked when they were awake. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day Opio went out hunting with his 
 dogs. After a short time, his dogs started 
 to chase an antelope. 
 
 Opio folowed them. He ran for many 
 hours. 
 Every time he became tired, he rested. 
 
 Then he would run again. But he could 
 not find his dogs. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 After many days, he came to a vilage. He
 went to one of the houses and said to
 
 the owner, “I have chased an antelope for
 a long time and I am very tired. I want to
 rest.” 
 
 The man said, “Sit down and rest. Would
 you like some ber?” 
 
 Opio was very thirsty so he drank some.
 Then he went to slep. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When he woke up, he couldn’t se. He
 opened and closed his eyes many times.
 
 “You have given me something very bad
 to drink,” he said to the man. “I can’t se
 properly anymore!” 
 
 “There is nothing wrong with you,” the
 man replied. “It’s night now. Haven’t you
 
 ever sen night? When the day leaves,
 the night comes.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Opio asked many questions about the 
 night. He began to like it very much. 
 
 He and his new friend talked until 
 morning. 
 He stayed for another day so that he 
 
 could se the night come again. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The next morning he asked his friend,
 “How can I take the night to my own
 
 vilage? I want my people to se the
 night.” 
 “When it starts to get dark this evening,
 
 walk to your vilage. If you lok straight in
 front, the night wil folow you. But you
 
 must not lok back. If you lok back, the
 night wil go away.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Opio did as he was told. That evening, he 
 began to walk towards his vilage. 
 
 He felt the dark night behind him as he 
 walked. 
 He wanted to lok back. 
 
 But he did not. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When he came to his vilage, the vilagers
 were afraid. 
 “What disease have you brought to us,
 
 Opio?” they asked. “What is this dark
 thing folowing you?” 
 Opio said, “My friends, this dark thing is
 
 caled night. Now you are afraid and I
 was afraid, to.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “But you wil learn to like the night. 
 When the light comes we can work and 
 
 when night comes, we can rest.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And that is how night came to Opio’s vilage.
